name: Blue & Green The Lake Spa Resort

reviews.text: Just back from a week at the Lake Spa in Vilamoura. I have to say that this place is good - clean, large pool areas, very nice gardens and lake, short walk to marina area (lots of other bars and restaurants and a few shops) and beaches. The two restaurants, in particular, are excellent and produce 5-star quality food. The floating restaurant is really nice, but pricey (175 euros for one admittedly big lobster - shared by two, but still, wow! Or did I miss the memo?).
reviews.title: Nice but not 5-star

reviews.text: But it's not really a 5-star place. The service is good, but can be painfully slow. The gym is ok but a lot of the equipment is either poorly maintained or broken. You can't really swim in any of the pools as they are too shallow. The rooms are fine but the corridors are long and gloomy, like business hotels in cities. The spa is average and massages are expensive and not very good.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The clientele is mainly young families - nothing wrong with that, but not a lot for families with teenagers aged up to 17 to do. The pool area is pretty busy, as you'd expect with young families, but the "no sunbed reserving" rule is completely ignored/not enforced, resulting in large numbers of premium site sunbeds being zoned off from about 6am by selfish families who don't turn up until afternoon and stay for about an hour. This needs to be sorted (preferably by flogging the culprits in the local town square) but I do concede there are a lot of other sunbeds to choose from.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All-in-all, I wouldn't go back as it doesn't deliver what we want from a resort as an older family, but I wouldn't stop anyone else from trying it.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Stay

reviews.text: Exterior of building impressive and modern,large external  beautiful green spaces around hotel buildings
reviews.title: Fantastic view and amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best hotel we have EVER stayed in. The room, the grounds, the wonderful friendly helpful staff, the breakfast, all just fabulous. Yes there are babies and young children but so what, they did not bother us they were in fact entertaining. If you don't want to see children on holiday go to an adult only hotel! We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Fabulous relaxing week

reviews.text: Lovely hotel in gorgeous surroundings only a 10 minute walk to the marina.We were really surprised at how many under 5s were in the hotel. As a middle aged couple we were expecting a quiet hotel , somewhere we could chill out and get away from the stress of our busy lives. I'm sorry to say that our peace was often shattered by screaming and crying youngsters at all times of the day and night. Our room was on the ground floor and our balcony opened up onto a grassed area near to the Fusion Restaurant . When in the room on an evening we liked to leave the door open but had to close it in the end as we couldn't hear ourselves think for the children screaming outside . I'm not blaming the children or the hotel but just point this out for the benefit of any older persons who may find this issue off putting.
reviews.title: Surprised at how many young children were there
Not really for couples
reviews.text: There was also a problem with the housekeeping. After a few days we did complain as our room still hadn't been cleaned at 4pm.

There was an evening turn down service which was a bit of a joke as it was usually done just after it had been cleaned and it seemed strange coming in around 5pm to find the turn down , curtains closed and lamps on. The downside to this was that if we wanted a shower in the morning there were no clean towels as the ones left were used the evening before, Not sure why the turndown was so early. In my experience it is usually done about 8 or 9pm . Never this early !!
reviews.title: What a treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely with lots of choice. Only ate at the pool bar once and it was average and lukewarm
reviews.title: 100% relaxation, just a few small flaws

reviews.text: We are just back from a lovely week in Vilamoura and really enjoyed staying in this fantastic hotel. I had booked this hotel based on the very good reviews on Tripadivor so I travelled with high expectations. I am happy to say that we were not disappointed. This is a top class hotel with excellent facilities. The resort is relatively new but is exceptionally well maintained. The hotel sits on a beautiful site with very well kept grounds including fantastic gardens, a lake and 3 pool. One of the pools is an artificial beach. There are a variety of places to enjoy the sun and the adjacent beach is beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with really friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on the edge of the Vilamoura marina and is close enough for everything to be accessible but you are a little removed from the activity which suited us just fine.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful. I was impressed with the pool staff who without asking noticed our son playing in the sand and brought him some beach toys and a shade to cover him while he played.
reviews.title: Try It You Will Not Be Disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is very hard to have any gripes about the place. I have read reviews commenting on the food being disappointing. I would say it is fine. It would be nice to have a bit more variety (ie a sandwich bar / salad bar at lunch) but the menu was fine and seemed to be popular with the guests that were there. We did not eat in the "Fusion" restaurant. Breakfast was good. We had no real complaints. My only other suggestion would be regarding the kids club. The facilities were top class but there was no real effort to get the kids involved with the result that our little fella didn't really go to it.
reviews.title: wonderful as always

reviews.text: We would definitely go back here again and would happily recommend it for an excellent destination for a family holiday.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing half term break

reviews.text: This is my first real visit to this part of the Algarve and I have been pleasantly surprised. Expecting the remnants of the 70s concrete jungles many towns have rejuvenated their town centres and given themselves a facelift that embrace what a modern tourist is looking for.
reviews.title: Where Country Club meets population explosion
Fantastically relaxing
reviews.text: The Lake Resort takes this to the extreme with its country club look and feel. Classical architecture and modern combine for a unique experience. Set at the end of the relatively new town of Vilamaoura and surrounded by an infinite number of golf courses, the manicured verges of the roadside and landscape succeed in making you escape to a land that is as authentic Portuguese as is Disneyland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lake resort is a relative new build exquisitely done in a low rise development set amongst some beautiful gardens. The rooms are well thought out and imaginatively spacious. When all that I can find to complain about the room is the location and design of the toilet roll holder, you know that they have got the room right. Pastel shades and modern decor make the place homely whilst remaining functional.
reviews.title: Second time at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The five star rating is well deserved. Complimentary underground parking and turn down serviceable included in the price. However the complimentary wifi is next to useless anywhere except at the hotel lobby. When you do manage to get a reliable connection you give serious thought to why you didn't pack the carrier pigeons for a faster delivery of your messages.
reviews.title: Lovely place
Fantastic friendly hotel
reviews.text: Staff are very friendly and helpful all the time. From the hardworking pool attendants to waiters and reception staff.

description: Five Star luxury resort with 192 rooms offering private balconies, with panoramic views over the marina of Vilamoura, Falésia beach or the private lake. Sports and leisure facilities include extensive gardens, three restaurants, two bars, a Spa with an indoor treatment pool and a Fitness Centre. It also has three outdoor pools, one of which has a natural sand bottom (the first in Europe), Koala Kids Club, Library, Boutique and free covered parking.
